conclusion: The graph starts at t = 0 with a positive velocity, decreases to zero at t = t0, then increases to a negative velocity at t = t1, and then decreases back to zero at some point beyond t1.
The particle is at the same position three times within the interval 0 to t1.
The velocity at time t is equal to the velocity at time 2*t0 - t, due to symmetry.
The total displacement from t = 0 to t = t1 is zero, meaning the particle ends up at the same position it started with at t = t1.
If it starts and ends at the same position, and passes through it three times, that means it goes away and comes back once, and then goes away and comes back again.
